meanings.definition: To embroider with a tambour needle.
meanings.sent1: She tamboured a beautiful flower onto the fabric.
meanings.sent2: The artisan tamboured intricate patterns on the cloth.
meanings.sent3: The tamboured design added elegance to the dress.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers tamboured the story of her journey.
meanings.sent5: The tamboured image seemed to come alive with each stitch.

meanings.sent1: The tamboured frame enhanced the beauty of the artwork.
meanings.sent2: The tamboured edges gave the piece a unique finish.
meanings.sent3: The tamboured details made the room feel cozy.
meanings.sent4: The tamboured surface reflected the light beautifully.
meanings.sent5: The tamboured border added a touch of sophistication to the tablecloth.
